aiAnalysis.summary: AFJ Limited's staging environment demonstrates adequate authentication controls with all admin endpoints properly protected (403 responses), and HTTPS is correctly implemented. However, there is a critical gap in security headers across all tested pages. Four pages are missing essential security headers, particularly X-Content-Type-Options and X-Frame-Options, which are fundamental defenses against MIME-type sniffing and clickjacking attacks. The absence of additional recommended headers (HSTS, CSP, Referrer-Policy, Permissions-Policy) further reduces the defense-in-depth posture. No data leakage was detected in API responses, which is positive.
recommendations: Immediately implement X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header on all pages to prevent MIME-type sniffing attacks
Add X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN (or DENY if framing is not required) to prevent clickjacking, especially on admin and sensitive pages like /quote
Deploy Strict-Transport-Security header with a minimum max-age of 31536000 seconds to enforce HTTPS-only communication
Implement Content-Security-Policy header with a restrictive policy appropriate to application functionality, starting with a report-only mode to identify violations
Add Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin to control referrer information leakage
Include Permissions-Policy header to restrict unnecessary browser APIs and features
Apply these headers globally via web server configuration (nginx/Apache) or application middleware rather than page-by-page to ensure consistency
Verify HSTS preload readiness and consider submitting to the HSTS preload list after deploying the header
